decision_conditions: The consent shall expire after 5 years from the date of this notice. | Any advertisements displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a clean and tidy condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. | Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a safe condition. | Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the removal shall be carried out to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. | No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission. | No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any road traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or so as otherwise to render hazardous the use of any highway, waterway (including any coastal waters) or aerodrome (civil or military).
Note: These are imposed automatically unless expressly varied, for instance the time limit shortened.

| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: Western Avenue Roadside Advertising Proposal, Part 1 (dated November 2021); Western Avenue Roadside Advertising Proposal, Part 2 Rev A (dated March 2022) (revision received 25.03.2022)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| The advertisement display hereby approved shall be limited to luminesce of 300cd/m2.

Reason: To protect the amenity and safety of adjoining premises and area in accordance with policies D3, D4 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| The signs must not have any moving features, animation, intermittent light source or exposed cold cathode tubing.

Reason: To protect the amenity and safety of adjoining premises and area in accordance with policies D3, D4 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| The signs must not flash or change colour.

Reason: To protect the amenity and safety of adjoining premises and area in accordance with policies D3, D4 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The minimum display time for each piece of content on the digital display screens shall be 10 seconds. The interval between each piece of content on the digital display screens shall take place over a period no greater than one second; the complete screen shall change with no visual effects (including swiping or other animated transition methods) between displays and the display will include a mechanism to freeze the image in the event of a malfunction.

Reason: To protect the amenity and safety of adjoining premises and area in accordance with policies D3, D4 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The footway and carriageway on Great West Road must not be blocked during the construction and maintenance of the proposal. Temporary obstruction during the installation must be kept to a minimum and should not encroach on the clear space needed to provide safe passage for pedestrian or obstruct the flow of traffic.
Reason: To protect the safety and security of all road users, in accordance with London Plan (2021) policy T4.
| No servicing vehicles associated with the proposed signs shall park/ load/ unload on the footway/carriageway of Great West Road at any time
Reason: To protect the safety and security of all road users, in accordance with London Plan (2021) policy T4.
| No content shall resemble traffic signs, as defined in section 64 of the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984.
Reason: To protect the safety and security of all road users, in accordance with London Plan (2021) policy T4.
description: Installation of single sided 48 sheet illuminated sequential display (Advertisement Consent)
